Type.Name: GC

TypeSignature.Value: public class GC : GLib.Object, IWrapper, IDisposable

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: Represents a graphics context

remarks.para: The Gdk.GC class is used to represent a graphics context.

A number of resources are used when performing graphics operations. Most information about performing graphics (for example, foreground color, background color, line style, and so on) is stored in resources called graphics contexts (GCs). Most graphics operations take a GC as an argument.

Graphics operations can be performed to either windows () or pixmaps (), which collectively are called drawables (see cref="T:Gdk.Drawable"/>). Each drawable exists on a single screen. A GC is created for a specific screen and drawable depth and can only be used with drawables of matching screen and depth.

Docs.summary: Copy the set of values from one graphics context onto another graphics context.

remarks.para: Copies the settings of the graphics context into this GC.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetTsOrigin (int x, int y);

Docs.summary: Set the origin when using tiles or stipples with the GC.

remarks.para: Set the origin when using tiles or stipples with the GC. The tile or stipple will be aligned such that the upper left corner of the tile or stipple will coincide with this point.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetClipOrigin (int x, int y);

Docs.summary: Sets the origin of the clip mask.

remarks.para: Sets the origin of the clip mask. The coordinates are interpreted relative to the upper-left corner of the destination drawable of the current operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Offset (int x_offset, int y_offset);

Docs.summary: Set the x and y offsets on the Gdk.GC
Docs.param: amount by which to offset the GC in the X direction
amount by which to offset the GC in the Y direction

remarks.para: Offset attributes such as the clip and tile-stipple origins of the GC so that drawing at x - x_offset, y - y_offset with the offset GC has the same effect as drawing at x, y with the original GC.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetDashes (int dash_offset, byte[] dash_list, int n);

Docs.summary: Sets the way dashed-lines are drawn.
Docs.param: the number of elemenst in dash_list.

remarks.para: Sets the way dashed-lines are drawn. Lines will be drawn with alternating on and off segments of the lengths specified in dash_list. The manner in which the on and off segments are drawn is determined by the line_style value of the GC. (This can be changed with Gdk.GC.SetLineAttributes())

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetValues (Gdk.GCValues values, Gdk.GCValuesMask values_mask);

Docs.summary: Sets attributes of a graphics context in bulk.
Docs.param: mask indicating which struct fields are to be used

remarks.para: Sets attributes of a graphics context in bulk. For each flag set in values_mask, the corresponding field will be read from values and set as the new value for gc. If you're only setting a few values on gc, calling individual "setter" functions is likely more convenient.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetLineAttributes (int line_width, Gdk.LineStyle line_style, Gdk.CapStyle cap_style, Gdk.JoinStyle join_style);

Docs.summary: Sets various attributes of how lines are drawn.
Docs.param: the manner in which the ends of lines are drawn.
the way in which lines are joined together.

remarks.para: Sets various attributes of how lines are drawn. See the corresponding members of Gdk.GC.Values for full explanations of the arguments.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the current values from a graphics context.
Docs.param: the GdkGCValues structure in which to store the results.

remarks.para: Retrieves the current values from a graphics context.

Docs.summary: Disposes the resources associated with the object.
Internal constructor
Docs.returns: Creates a new instance of GC, using the GLib-provided type

remarks.para: This is a constructor used by derivative types of that would have their own GLib type assigned to it. This is not typically used by C# code.

Docs.summary: Internal constructor
Docs.returns: An instance of GC, wrapping the C object.

remarks.para: This is an internal constructor, and should not be used by user code.

Docs.summary: To be added
Docs.param: To be added: an object of type 'Gdk.Drawable'
Docs.returns: To be added: an object of type 'Gdk.GC'

MemberSignature.Value: public GC (Gdk.Drawable drawable, Gdk.GCValues values, Gdk.GCValuesMask values_mask);

Docs.summary: To be added
Docs.param: To be added: an object of type 'Gdk.Drawable'
To be added: an object of type 'Gdk.GCValues'
To be added: an object of type 'Gdk.GCValuesMask'
Docs.returns: To be added: an object of type 'Gdk.GC'

Docs.summary: To be added
Docs.returns: To be added: an object of type 'Gdk.GC'

Docs.summary: The GLib Type for Gdk.GC
Docs.returns: The GLib TYpe for the Gdk.GC class.

Docs.summary: Set the foreground color of a GC using an unallocated color.

remarks.para: Set the foreground color of a GC using an unallocated color. The pixel value for the color will be determined using GdkRGB. If the colormap for the GC has not previously been initialized for GdkRGB, then for pseudo-color colormaps (colormaps with a small modifiable number of colors), a colorcube will be allocated in the colormap.
Calling this function for a GC without a colormap is an error.

Docs.summary: Sets the clip mask for a graphics context from a rectangle.

remarks.para: Sets the clip mask for a graphics context from a rectangle. The clip mask is interpreted relative to the clip origin. (See ).

Docs.summary: Set a tile pixmap for a graphics context.

remarks.para: Set a tile pixmap for a graphics context. This will only be used if the fill mode is GDK_TILED.

Docs.summary: Sets the clip mask for a graphics context from a bitmap.

remarks.para: Sets the clip mask for a graphics context from a bitmap. The clip mask is interpreted relative to the clip origin. (See ).

Docs.summary: Set the fill mode for a graphics context.

remarks.para: Set the fill mode for a graphics context.

Docs.summary: Sets the colormap for the GC to the given colormap.

remarks.para: Fetches or changes the colormap of the GC. The depth of the colormap's visual must match the depth of the drawable for which the GC was created.

Docs.summary: Set the background color of a GC using an unallocated color.

remarks.para: Set the background color of a GC using an unallocated color. The pixel value for the color will be determined using GdkRGB. If the colormap for the GC has not previously been initialized for GdkRGB, then for pseudo-color colormaps (colormaps with a small modifiable number of colors), a colorcube will be allocated in the colormap.
Calling this function for a GC without a colormap is an error.

Docs.summary: Sets the foreground color for a graphics context.

remarks.para: Sets the foreground color for a graphics context to the given color. The color must have been allocated for this to work.

Docs.summary: Sets the clip mask for a graphics context from a region structure.

remarks.para: Sets the clip mask for a graphics context from a region structure. The clip mask is interpreted relative to the clip origin. (See ).

Docs.summary: Sets how drawing with this GC on a window will affect child windows of that window.

remarks.para: Sets how drawing with this GC on a window will affect child windows of that window.

Docs.summary: Set the stipple bitmap for a graphics context.

remarks.para: Set the stipple bitmap for a graphics context. The stipple will only be used if the fill mode is or .

Docs.summary: Determines how the current pixel values and the pixel values being drawn are combined to produce the final pixel values.

remarks.para: Determines how the current pixel values and the pixel values being drawn are combined to produce the final pixel values.

Docs.summary: Sets the background color for a graphics context.

remarks.para: Sets the background color for a graphics context. The color must have been allocated.

Docs.summary: Sets whether or not this GC should geenrate exposure events.
Docs.param: To be added: an object of type 'bool'
Docs.returns: To be added: an object of type 'bool'

remarks.para: Sets whether copying non-visible portions of a drawable using this graphics context generate exposure events for the corresponding regions of the destination drawable. (See ).
